shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary” (fols. 1va-227vc) I-1) ʾƎsäggǝd läki wä-ʾǝweddǝsäki ... “I worship Thee ...” (fol. 3ra-rc) I-2) Introductory exhortation and hymns (fols. 1va-2rc, 3rc-vc) I-3) Mäṣḥafä śǝrʿat, Introductory rite of al-Muʿallaqah and hymn (fol. 4ra-8ra) I-4) Täʾamrä Maryam “Miracles of Mary”: 196 miracles (fols. 9ra-227vc), incomplete

donors.donor: The names of the original donors have been erased throughout the Ms. and replaced with Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus, often together with the names of his mother Wälättä Ṣǝyon, his father Wäldä Lǝʿul and Gäbrä Samuʾel (in red, until fol. 109vc), written in a secondary hand. In some cases, the original names have been preserved in supplication formulas: Hǝryaqos on fol. 12va, Zena Gäbrǝʾel fols. 204vb-212rb, 219vb-227va, and Täklä Haymanot fols. 213vb-218vc.

dcomments.dcomment: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus is the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis or Säbagadis, the ruler of Tǝgray in 1822-31. The replacement of the name of the original donors by that of his name hints that the Ms. was written not later than in the early 19th century.

txstates.txstate: Textile inlays were crudely glued on the turn-ins. The Ms was resewn, a new leather cover was laid on the boards, probably upon the original covering. The leaves of quire I are misplaced. The fol. given the number 000a consists of two small, unruled pieces of parchment sewn together with parchment strips. Fol. 8 is heavily mutilated, only the written part (6 lines of the first column) are preserved. Fols. 4r-7v with Text I-3 show traces of extensive use. Fol. 228 is made of two pieces sewn together with parchment strips. Many leaves are affected by humidity. Holes or tears amended on fols. 2, 3, 21, 29, 30-33, 41, 48, 56, 70, 89, 104, 112, 123, 124, 138, 156, 191, 192, 204, 215-217, 219.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with deep rose tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the deep rose leather cover (5 tools were used: triple line fillet, double, circle, cross hatching, wave form with dots, interlaced line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: I(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 4/fols. 0ar-4v) – II(7; s.l.: 7, stub before 1/fols. 5r-11v) – III(8/fol. 12r-19v) – IV(8/fols. 20r-27v) – V(8/fols. 28r-35v) – VI(8/fols. 36r-43v) – VII(8/fols. 44r-51v) – VIII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – IX(8/fols. 60r-67v) – X(8/fols. 68r-75v) – XI(8/fols. 76-83v) – XII(8/fols. 84r-91v) – XIII(8/fol. 92r-99v) – XIV(8/fols. 100r-107v) – XV(8/fols. 108r-115v) – XVI(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVII(8/fols. 124r-131v) – XVIII(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XIX(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XXX(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XXI(8/fols. 156-163v) – XXII(8/fols. 164r-171v) – XXIII(8/fol. 172r-179v) – XXIV(8/fols. 180r-187v) – XXV(8/fols. 188r-195v) – XXVI(8/fols. 196r-203v) – XXVII(8/fols. 204r-211v) – XXVIII(8/fols. 212r-219v) – XXIX(9; s.l.: 9, stub before 1/fols. 220r-228v)

taunit.mr-info: Quire I: all data for fol. 2r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quires II-XII: all data for fol. 6r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quires XIII-XXV: all data for fol. 93r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Quires XXVI-XXIX: all data for fol. 197r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The size of the script differs quite significantly (cp. fols. 14r vs. 195r), but it seems that only one scribe was involved in writing. The distinctive feature of ድ: the 6th order vowel marker is attached at the lower part of the loop.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; names of the donors; the word sälam "salutation" in Text I-3; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Two initial lines of the incipit of Text I-1; initial line of the incipit of Text I-2; several groups of lines on the incipit page of Texts I-3 and I-4, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of the sections of Texts I-2, and I-4 (miracles).

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The correct order of fols. 1-16 containing Texts I-1 and I-2 is as follows: Text I-1: fols. 3ra-rc; Text I-2: fols. 3rc-vc, 1va-2rc.
Text I-3, partly with interlineal musical notation (in brown ink), contains: - Sälam läki ḫoḫǝtä mǝśraq ... "Salutation to you, Threshold of the East…" (fols. 7vc-8ra)
The introduction to Text I-4 (Miracles of Mary) is similar to the beginning of Text I-2. The miracles are numbered.

extras.extra: - Texts I-1 and I-2 are written in small script. - Elements of numerals and of punctuation are not rubricated in quires II-V, XVII-XXVI. - Spaces for the names of the donor(s) to be rubricated are left unfilled on fols. 3va and 124r-203v (quires XVII-XXVI). - Space for the rubricated incipit of a miracle is left unfilled on fols. 16rb. - The names of the donors were erased and not replaced with that of other names on fol. 30va, 107va, 111rc-123ra. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 5ra, 7rb, 14va, 19rc, 24va, 36rb, 43rb, 44rc, 61rb, 75rb, 84rb, 87rc, 99ra, 109rc, 149rc, 156va, 164rc, 166vc, 169rc, 179rb, 182vc, 200va, 209rb, 225vc. - Erasures marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 14va, 14vc, 17rc, 20vc, 25rb, 47ra, 50va, 57ra, 72rb, 114rb, 128rc, 185rb, 211rc. - Tämälläs-signs (in the shape of +) indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: fols. 10vc, 21va, 62va, 63rb, 97rc, 126ra, 135ra, 186rc, 193va, 209rc, 227vb. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 12ra, 3rc, 162vb. - The miracle numbers are inserted in the margins or between the miracles in the text columns. - Short note (እስከ፡ ዚህ) on fol. 219v, at the bottom margin. - Erased notes in the margin of fol. 39r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
The following note, written on fol. 5rb in red in a secondary hand, indicates the reading for Gǝnbot: ንህነ፡ ንብል፡ ጥዩቀ፡ በከመ፡ መሐሩነ፡ አበዊነ፡ ሊቃውንት፡ አመአሚሩ፡ ለግንቦት፡ ልደት. In addition, other readings are indicated by the names of the feasts or months, crudely written in the upper margin, in pen: fols. 11ra, 30vb, 49rb, 64vc, 72va, 79va, 122vc, 124vb, 125ra, 143rb, 150ra, 170va.
(Coloured) threads inserted in the outer margin of fols. 17, 34, 49, 56, 79, 122, 170, 191.
